localizedDescriptions.en: Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).
Additional composition metadata options for EHR.Network to cover for what is not already available from the Reference Model COMPOSITION class.
A term/number specifying the level of confidentiality of the Document. A number which can be mapped to the access control permissions
Name of theplatform tenant through which the data has been recorded
ID of theplatform tenant through which the data has been recorded
Name of the application that created the composition
Registration id of the committing application
The subjective clinical history of the subject of care as recorded directly by the subject, or reported to a clinician by the subject or a carer.
Narrative description of the story or clinical history for the subject of care.
Reported observation of a physical or mental disturbance in an individual.
The name of the reported symptom or sign.

annotations.comment: Symptom name should be coded with a terminology, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: The identified symptom or sign was reported as not being present to any significant degree.

annotations.comment: Record as True if the subject of care has reported the symptom as not significant. For example: if the individual has never experienced the symptom it is appropriate to record 'nil significant'; or if the individual commonly experiences the symptom, in some circumstances it may be considered appropriate to record 'nil significant' if the individual has experienced no deviation from their 'normal' baseline.

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative description about the reported symptom or sign.
Simple body site where the symptom or sign was reported.

annotations.comment:
Occurrences of this data element are set to 0..* to allow multiple body sites to be separated out in a template if desired. This allows for representation of clinical scenarios where a symptom or sign needs to be recorded in multiple locations or identifying both the originating and distal site in pain radiation, but where all of the other attributes such as impact and duration are identical. If the requirements for recording the body site are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the Detailed anatomical location' SLOT in this archetype. 
If the anatomical location is included in the Symptom name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.  If the anatomical location is recorded using the 'Structured body site' SLOT, then use of this data element is not allowed - record only the simple 'Body site' OR 'Structured body site', but not both.

localizedDescriptions.en: Category of this episode for the identified symptom or sign.
A new episode of the symptom or sign - either the first ever occurrence or a reoccurrence where the previous episode had completely resolved.
This symptom or sign is ongoing, effectively a single, continuous episode.
It is not possible to determine if this occurrence of the symptom or sign is new or ongoing.
Is this the first ever occurrence of this symptom or sign?

annotations.comment: Record as True if this is the first ever occurrence of this symptom or sign.

localizedDescriptions.en: The onset for this episode of the symptom or sign.

annotations.comment: While partial dates are permitted, the exact date and time of onset can be recorded, if appropriate. If this symptom or sign is experienced for the first time or is a re-occurrence, this date is used to represent the onset of this episode. If this symptom or sign is ongoing, this data element may be redundant if it has been recorded previously.

localizedDescriptions.en: Description of the onset of the symptom or sign.

annotations.comment: The type of the onset can be coded with a terminology, if desired. For example: gradual; or sudden.

localizedDescriptions.en: The duration of this episode of the symptom or sign since onset.

annotations.comment: If 'Date/time of onset' and 'Date/time of resolution' are used in systems, this data element may be calculated, or alternatively, be considered redundant in this scenario.

localizedDescriptions.en: Category representing the overall severity of the symptom or sign.

annotations.comment: Defining values such as mild, moderate or severe in such a way that is applicable to multiple symptoms or signs plus allows multiple users to interpret and record them consistently is not easy. Some organisations extend the value set further with inclusion of additional values such as 'Trivial' and 'Very severe', and/or 'Mild-Moderate' and 'Moderate-Severe', adds to the definitional difficulty and may also worsen inter-recorder reliability issues. Use of 'Life-threatening' and 'Fatal' is also often considered as part of this value set, although from a pure point of view it may actually reflect an outcome rather than a severity. In view of the above, keeping to a well-defined but smaller list is preferred and so the mild/moderate/severe value set is offered, however the choice of other text allows for other value sets to be included at this data element in a template. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the 'Specific details' SLOT.

localizedDescriptions.en: The intensity of the symptom or sign does not cause interference with normal activity.
The intensity of the symptom or sign causes interference with normal activity.
The intensity of the symptom or sign causes prevents normal activity.
Numerical rating scale representing the overall severity of the symptom or sign.

annotations.comment: Symptom severity can be rated by the individual by recording a score from 0 (ie symptom not present) to 10.0 (ie symptom is as severe as the individual can imagine). This score can be represented in the user interface as a visual analogue scale. The data element has occurrences set to 0..* to allow for variations such as 'maximal severity' or 'average severity' to be included in a template.

localizedDescriptions.en: Description progression of the symptom or sign at the time of reporting.

annotations.comment: Occurrences of this data element are set to 0..* to allow multiple types of progression to be separated out in a template if desired - for example, severity or frequency.

localizedDescriptions.en: The severity of the symptom or sign has worsened overall during this episode.
The severity of the symptom or sign has not changed overall during this episode.
The severity of the symptom or sign has improved overall during this episode.
The severity of the symptom or sign has resolved.
Narrative description about the pattern of the symptom or sign during this episode.

annotations.comment: For example: pain could be described as constant or intermittent.

localizedDescriptions.en: Detail about how a specific factor effects the identified symptom or sign during this episode.
Name of the modifying factor.

annotations.comment: Examples of modifying factor: lying on multiple pillows, eating or administration of a specific medication.

localizedDescriptions.en: Perceived effect of the modifying factor on the symptom or sign.
The factor decreases the severity or impact of the symptom or sign, but does not fully resolve it.
The factor has no impact on the symptom or sign.
The factor increases the severity or impact of the symptom or sign.
Narrative description of the effect of the modifying factor on the symptom or sign.
Identification of factors or events that trigger the onset or commencement of the symptom or sign.

annotations.comment: For example: onset of headache occurred one week prior to menstruation; or onset of headache occurred one hour after fall of bicycle.

localizedDescriptions.en: Name of the health event, symptom, reported sign or other factor.

annotations.comment: For example: onset of another symptom; onset of menstruation; or fall off bicycle.

localizedDescriptions.en: The interval of time between the occurrence or onset of the factor and onset/resolution of the symptom or sign.
Narrative description about the effect of the factor on the identified symptom or sign.
Identification of factors or events that trigger resolution or cessation of the symptom or sign.

annotations.comment: For example: onset of headache occurred one week prior to menstruation; or onset of headache occurred one hour after fall of bicycle.

localizedDescriptions.en: Name of the health event, symptom, reported sign or other factor.

annotations.comment: For example: onset of another symptom; onset of menstruation; or fall off bicycle.

localizedDescriptions.en: The interval of time between the occurrence or onset of the factor and onset/resolution of the symptom or sign.
Narrative description about the effect of the factor on the identified symptom or sign.
Description of the impact of this symptom or sign.

annotations.comment: Assessment of impact could consider the severity, duration and frequency of the symptom as well as the type of impact including, but not limited to, functional, social and emotional impact. Occurrences of this data element are set to 0..* to allow multiple types of impact to be separated out in a template if desired. Examples for functional impact from hearing loss may include: 'Difficulty Hearing in Quiet Environment'; 'Difficulty Hearing the TV or Radio'; 'Difficulty Hearing Group Conversation'; and 'Difficulty Hearing on Phone'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative description about the course of the symptom or sign during this episode.

annotations.comment: For example: a text description of the immediate onset of the symptom, activities that worsened or relieved the symptom, whether it is improving or worsening and how it resolved over weeks.

localizedDescriptions.en: The timing of the cessation of this episode of the symptom or sign.

annotations.comment: If 'Date/time of onset' and 'Duration' are used in systems, this data element may be calculated, or alternatively, considered redundant. While partial dates are permitted, the exact date and time of resolution can be recorded, if appropriate.

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative description of any or all previous episodes.

annotations.comment: For example: frequency/periodicity - per hour, day, week, month, year; and regularity. May include a comparison to this episode.

localizedDescriptions.en: The number of times this symptom or sign has previously occurred.
Additional narrative about the symptom or sign not captured in other fields.
